7.29.22  3:16 pm   why is it so hard to say words even though i plan exactly what needs to be said immediately prior to attempting to say it

      that's exactly the problem: the time difference. instead of planning it before, try planning it at the exact moment you say it. you may surprise yourself, and that should be just enough to put everyone in a fresh mood

Oh I don't wanna do ittttttt

7.29.22  6:38 am   I have to do a 114 bar alto sax solo completely improvised for a concert that's coming up in a few weeks. How do i make it sound interesting?

      if you try to make it interesting, the audience will be interested, but not in the way that you want. they will sense that you are stressed out and they will be interested in how stressed out you are, just from a curiosity standpoint. there's really only 1 way to approach this........ try to make it 'uninteresting' on purpose. that's impossible, so that's the whole key to the trick

7.29.22  5:20 am   i am sad how do i make myself happier?

      one weird trick is to make someone else happy and then that will set off a chain reaction throughout the multi verse

      i have one of the re-generating ones

      ......much

7.29.22  12:32 am   How does time work? Does it just go? Or is it the music of reality?

      it's the moves in a chess game. each time 1 move is made, that's considered 1 unit forward in the timeline of the game. the player, however, must have special priveldge of existing in between the units to contemplate multiple options for future gametime units. nevermind, you are right, it is music

7.28.22  10:04 pm   do you think it's possible to avoid making the same mistakes as our ancestors?

      some of them but not all of them

7.28.22  8:43 pm   whats a question you cannot answer

      it would be this one except if i answered it then that would no longer be the correct answer

7.28.22  6:37 pm   hey bill, I'm trying to learn a new instrument  and its not super easy to like kinda figure out a starting point of like where to start learning, and i figured since you play a ton of stuff i should ask if you kinda had any advice on how to start learning?

     the magic of music all comes from right in that limbo state in between 2 choices. basically it's the space that the "no free will" nay-sayers will say shouldn't exist. but it powers all of music. just get near your instrument (or far, whatever) and just keep contemplating whether or not you should touch the instrument. change your mind. you can touch the instrument, or not, either way, but the wild ride happens as these 2 extremes battle it out within your soul

     This also goes for video editing, I am not really sure what to start with. Any advice? Thanks!

      start with a blank space, maybe a rectangle, as long as you're getting into the video mindset (most videos are probably rectangular). and just exercise the opportunity to possibly put 1 dot on the page, anywhere. specifically call upon your ability to place the dot at any location on the page. try to find a place where you think no one has ever put the dot before. or, try to find the place where you think is the absolute #1 most common location for the dot to possibly be placed. or, if you are feeling absolutely ridiculous, you can try to place the dot in a location that has a uniqueness level of exactly 50%

7.28.22  4:17 am   for 'new arrivals in india', is this transcription even in the same zip code of correct:

new arrivals in in...
D     A Bmin A  Ebmin7
(could put inversions here but there's clearly no bass yet so no discernible point to doing that)

...dia, maybe it's those horse people i was talkin about
   Bb7sus4               Bbsus4/Gb          Bb/C

or their cousins or something
         Bbmin7/Ab  Bbsus4/C

and they wrote some hymns and mantras and stuff
                    C#sus4/A     Dbma7/Ab

there could be a D# in that C#sus4/A chord i dunn o

      well, here is the original reference recoring of the composition, from july 17, 2016. just listening through this it seems like you got most of the important turns. there are some ghost chords in between, i was actually composing every individual syllable. but who knows if those passing bits actually made it onto the final recording. i'm surprised your transcription matches this demo so well. that's credit to both your transcription accuracy and my determination to do it exactly the way i composed it, even though i probably didn't produce these jingles until 6 months later and multiple more millennia of history research

7.27.22  3:46 am   in "mount st. helens is about to blow up", what are the chords for "ground and turn grey"

     "ground and" would be D/E ("D over E"), "turn" may slightly touch on Emin7 as a resolve from the D/E, and "grey" is E/A ("E over A"). or you can call it "Asus2maj7" if you prefer

     and then for "mount st. helens is feeling crazy and adventurous"?

     "mount st. helens is feeling" should be some kind of Bbmaj9. "crazy" should be something like Csus2 over A. Somewhere near "zy and", the bass should go to D, which makes it something like D7sus4 or maybe D9sus4, also known as C over D. "adventurous" is some kind of Gmaj9.
